newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas stocks firm on Electricidad rise.
newsitem.headline: Caracas stocks firm on Electricidad rise.

text.p: Caracas stocks firmed for the second day as foreign investors bought Electricidad de Caracas and snapped up other undervalued stocks, traders said.
"The bolsa bounced back after it was oversold earlier this week," said Intervalores broker Ricardo Marino.
The Venezuelan bolsa slumped earlier this week as foreign investors sold on fears U.S. interest rates would rise.
"It was foreign investors that dumped Electricidad on Wednesday and its been foreign investors that are now bringing it back again," said another trader.
The market's index rose one percent to close at 6,209.84 points as 24 stocks rose, six fell and 12 closed flat.

Electricidad gained 5.00 bolivars in strong trade to close at 525.00. Among other widely held stocks, cement company Vencemos rose 5.35 and 44.00 bolivars respectively to end at 1,260.00 and 1090.00 after investment bank Credit Lyonnais rated the share a buy.
A total of 18.47 million shares exchanged hands, worth 3 billion bolivars ($6.4 million).
